title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality narrated by the young Scout Finch.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society under constant surveillance.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that also critiques the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel about the American dream and the disillusionment that came with it during the Jazz Age.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: The narrative of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill the giant white whale, Moby Dick.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A historical novel that chronicles the French invasion of Russia and its impact on Tsarist society.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story about teenage rebellion and angst narrated by the cynical Holden Caulfield.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic fantasy novel about the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat Sauron.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: A satirical allegory of Soviet totalitarianism in the form of a farm animal uprising.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: The story of a young orphaned girl’s life and her growth into adulthood.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel set in a futuristic world where society is controlled by technology and conditioning.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A tragic love story set on the Yorkshire moors featuring the characters Heathcliff and Catherine.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An epic poem that follows the Greek hero Odysseus on his journey home after the Trojan War.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological drama about the moral dilemmas faced by a destitute student who commits a murder.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical novel exploring faith, doubt, and the familial relationships among the Karamazov brothers.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel about the adventures of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who embarks on an unexpected journey.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A tragic story of love and infidelity set against the backdrop of Russian society.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: The story of the orphan Pip and his growth and personal development through life.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: A multi-generational story of the Buendía family, set in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: Ulysses
author: James Joyce
description: A modernist novel that parallels the adventures of Ulysses in Homer’s epic poem.

title: Madame Bovary
author: Gustave Flaubert
description: The story of Emma Bovary's quest for romantic fulfillment and her ultimate downfall.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
description: An epic poem describing the author’s journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: The story of a nobleman who becomes a self-styled knight and his adventures with his squire.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
description: An epic poem recounting the significant events of the final weeks of the Trojan War.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A novel about a young scientist who creates a sapient creature in an unorthodox experiment.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: A gothic horror novel about the vampire Count Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to England.
